And he said unto me, Son of man, stand upon thy feet, and I will speak unto thee.
And the spirit entered into me when he spake unto me, and set me upon my feet, that I heard him that spake unto me.

And he said unto me, Son of man, I send thee to the children of Israel, to a rebellious nation that hath rebelled against me: they and their fathers have transgressed against me, <FI>even<Fi> unto this very day.<RF>nation: Heb. nations<Rf>
For <FI>they are<Fi> impudent children and stiffhearted. I do send thee unto them; and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD.<RF>impudent: Heb. hard of face<Rf>
And they, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear, (for they <FI>are<Fi> a rebellious house,) yet shall know that there hath been a prophet among them.<CM>

And thou, son of man, be not afraid of them, neither be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns <FI>be<Fi> with thee, and thou dost dwell among scorpions: be not afraid of their words, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they <FI>be<Fi> a rebellious house.<RF>briers…: or, rebels<Rf>
And thou shalt speak my words unto them, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear: for they <FI>are<Fi> most rebellious.<RF>most…: Heb. rebellion<Rf>
But thou, son of man, hear what I say unto thee; Be not thou rebellious like that rebellious house: open thy mouth, and eat that I give thee.
And when I looked, behold, an hand <FI>was<Fi> sent unto me; and, lo, a roll of a book <FI>was<Fi> therein;
And he spread it before me; and it <FI>was<Fi> written within and without: and <FI>there was<Fi> written therein lamentations, and mourning, and woe.<CM>
